  5. ‚ë§ User/Post Data: User metadata + Post content caches/DBs se fetch hota hai

Note: Static media (images/videos) directly CDN se serve hota hai for low latency!

üìä Deep Dive Topics - Usually Kis Cheez Par Hota Hai?

A) Data Model / Storage Design

Interviewer aksar tumse data model define karne ko bolega. Tum clearly tables/collections define karo:

üìä Core Tables: 
// Post Table
{
  post_id: UUID (PK),
  user_id: UUID (FK),
  content: TEXT,
  media_urls: ARRAY[VARCHAR],
  created_at: TIMESTAMP,
  updated_at: TIMESTAMP
}

// User Table
{
  user_id: UUID (PK),
  username: VARCHAR,
  profile_metadata: JSONB,
  created_at: TIMESTAMP
}

// Graph Store (Friendship/Follower edges)
{
  user_id: UUID,
  friend_id: UUID,
  relationship_type: ENUM('friend', 'follower'),
  created_at: TIMESTAMP
  PRIMARY KEY (user_id, friend_id)
}
B) Feed Generation Strategy - Critical Tradeoff!

Yahan tum 2 approaches compare karte ho aur best solution propose karte ho:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Fanout-on-Write (Push Model)
  • Write time par followers ke feed mein push kar do
  • ‚úÖ Reads super fast (pre-computed)
  • ‚ùå Celebrity users ka fanout expensive
  • ‚ùå High write amplification
2Ô∏è‚É£ Fanout-on-Read (Pull Model)
  • Read time par graph se posts fetch karke build karo
  • ‚úÖ Write cheap aur simple
  • ‚ùå Reads slow (compute at read time)
  • ‚ùå High read latency for users with many friends
üåü Strong Answer: Hybrid Approach!
  • Normal users (< 10K followers): Push model - fanout to all followers
  • Celebrity users (> 10K followers): Pull model ya partial precompute
  • At read time: Merge precomputed feed + pull celebrity posts on-demand

Is approach se tum both extremes ka best le sakte ho - normal cases fast hain, aur celebrities system ko overload nahi karte!

C) Cache Strategy - Multi-Layer Caching

Caching system design ka core hai. Tum multiple cache layers define karo:

Cache Name Key ‚Üí Value Purpose
NewsFeedCache user_id ‚Üí list[post_ids] Recent post IDs for user's feed
PostCache post_id ‚Üí post_object Full post content + metadata
UserCache user_id ‚Üí user_metadata User profile info for display
üîß Cache Details Explain Karo:
  • Eviction Policy: LRU (Least Recently Used) for feed cache
  • TTL: News feed cache = 24 hours, Post cache = 7 days
  • Cache Warm-up: Pre-populate popular users' caches on service startup
  • Cache Miss Handling: Fallback to DB, then async populate cache
D) Queue + Async Processing

Fanout workers queue se consume karte hain. Ye architecture async processing ka core hai:

‚öôÔ∏è Queue Processing Details:
  • Retry Strategy: Exponential backoff with max 3 retries
  • Idempotency: Use unique message IDs to avoid duplicate pushes
  • Dead-Letter Queue (DLQ): Failed messages after all retries go to DLQ for manual review
  • Ordering: Per-user ordering guarantee for consistent feed
E) Consistency vs Availability Tradeoff

CAP theorem ke context mein tumhara stance clearly explain karo:

üí¨ Interview Mein Aise Bolo:

"News feed ke context mein, eventual consistency acceptable hai. Post immediately sabke feed mein na dikhne ka small delay (few seconds) acceptable hai, lekin system highly available hona chahiye - users ko kabhi bhi 'service unavailable' nahi dikhna chahiye."

üìä Consistency Levels by Use Case:
  • Feed reads: Eventual consistency ‚úÖ
  • Post writes: Strong consistency for author's view
  • Like/Comment counts: Eventual consistency ‚úÖ
  • Friend requests: Strong consistency needed
‚úÖ Step 3 End Karte Time Aise Bolo:

"Ab main wrap up karke summary, bottlenecks identification, aur potential improvements discuss karta hoon taaki design complete ho jaye."

üî∑

Step 4: Wrap Up - Strong Finish + Senior Signals

üî∑ Step 4: Interview Ko Strong Finish Do (3-5 minutes)
üéØ Step 4 Ka Core Purpose:

Most candidates yahan weak ho jaate hain, lekin tum yahan se apna impression solid kar sakte ho! Wrap up mein tum apni senior-level thinking demonstrate karte ho - bottlenecks awareness, operational readiness, aur future growth planning.

‚úÖ Wrap Up Mein Tumhe Kya Cover Karna Chahiye?

1Ô∏è‚É£ Summary Recap Do (30-45 seconds)

Tum apna entire design quickly summarize karo:

üí¨ Example Summary:

"To summarize, humne request routing DNS se load balancer ke through web servers tak setup kiya. Read path ko cache-heavy architecture se optimize kiya jahan feed pre-computed hai. Write path mein async fanout use kiya message queues ke saath. Media content CDN se serve ho raha hai for global low latency. Aur humne hybrid fanout strategy use ki to handle celebrity users efficiently."

2Ô∏è‚É£ Bottlenecks Identify Karo + Solutions Suggest Karo

Tum openly potential issues bolo aur unke solutions mention karo:

Bottleneck Mitigation Strategy
DB Hotspots Sharding by user_id, read replicas
Celebrity Fanout Hybrid push/pull, background precompute
Cache Stampede Request coalescing, staggered TTLs
Queue Backlog Auto-scaling workers, priority queues
3Ô∏è‚É£ Failure Cases Discuss Karo (Senior Signal! üåü)

Production systems fail hote hain. Tum mention karo ki system failures ko kaise handle karega:

  • Cache Down: Fallback to DB + rate limiting to prevent DB overload
  • DB Partition Issue: Automatic replica failover + connection retry logic
  • Worker Crash: Message retry mechanism + Dead Letter Queue for investigation
  • Network Partition: Graceful degradation - show cached/stale content
4Ô∏è‚É£ Monitoring + Ops (Production Readiness Signal! üåü)

Ye operational maturity ka strong signal deta hai:

  • Key Metrics: Latency (p50, p99), QPS, error rate, cache hit rate, queue lag
  • Logging + Tracing: Distributed tracing for request flow debugging
  • Alerts: PagerDuty/OpsGenie alerts on SLA breaches
  • Deployment Strategy: Canary releases, blue-green deployments
  • Rollback Plan: Quick rollback mechanism if issues detected
5Ô∏è‚É£ Scaling Next Curve (1M ‚Üí 10M ‚Üí 100M Users)

Tum high level changes bolo jo scale ke saath required honge:

  • Data Layer: Sharding + partitioning strategy (consistent hashing)
  • Cache Layer: Distributed cache clusters (Redis Cluster)
  • CDN: Multi-CDN strategy for global reach
  • Async Pipelines: Auto-scaling worker pools
  • Multi-Region: Active-active deployment for lower latency
6Ô∏è‚É£ Future Refinements (Agar Time Ho)

Agar time bachta hai to additional improvements mention karo:

  • Ranking Algorithm: Move from chronological to relevance-based ranking
  • Personalization: User preference-based content filtering
  • ML Recommendations: Collaborative filtering for content discovery
  • Storage Optimization: Better compression, tiered storage (hot/cold)
‚úÖ Wrap Up End Line:

"Is design mein main key bottlenecks celebrity fanout aur cache stampede dekhta hoon, aur scale ke saath main sharding + multi-region deployment improvements apply karunga. Kya aap chahenge main kisi specific component mein aur deep dive karoon?"

üìã

System Design Interview: DOs & DON'Ts

üìã DOs aur DON'Ts - Interview Success Ke Liye Must-Know Rules!

‚úÖ DOs (Ye Definitely Karo!)

  • 1. Tumhe always clarification puchni chahiye aur assumptions blindly nahi leni chahiye. Questions puchna weakness nahi, strength hai!
  • 2. Tumhe requirements clearly samajhni chahiye, kyunki system design ka "one best answer" nahi hota - context matters!
  • 3. Tumhe interviewer ko continuously batana chahiye ki tum kya think kar rahe ho - "think aloud" karna zaroori hai!
  • 4. Tum multiple approaches suggest kar sakte ho aur tradeoffs explain kar sakte ho - ye senior thinking dikhata hai!
  • 5. Tum blueprint finalize karne ke baad sabse critical components ko pehle design karna chahiye - prioritize wisely!
  • 6. Tumhe interviewer ko teammate ki tarah treat karna chahiye, aur unke ideas par bounce back karna chahiye - collaborate!
  • 7. Tumhe stuck hone par give up nahi karna chahiye - hints maango, different angle try karo, but keep going!

‚ùå DON'Ts (Ye Avoid Karo!)

  • 1. Tumhe unprepared nahi rehna chahiye - typical system design patterns ka exposure hona chahiye before interview!
  • 2. Tumhe bina requirements clarify kiye solution par jump nahi karna chahiye - ye major red flag hai!
  • 3. Tumhe start mein hi ek single component mein too much detail mein nahi ghusna chahiye - pehle high-level, phir drill down!
  • 4. Tumhe stuck hone par silent nahi hona chahiye - hints maangna allowed hai, silence is a negative signal!
  • 5. Tumhe interview ko "design deke done" nahi samajhna chahiye - interviewer jab tak bole tab tak iterate karte rehna chahiye aur feedback actively lena chahiye!
üìö Chapter 3: System Design Interview Framework COMPLETE! üéâ

Ab tum confidently 4-step framework use kar sakte ho system design interviews mein. Remember: Step 1 mein scope lock karo, Step 2 mein high-level blueprint banao, Step 3 mein critical components deep dive karo, aur Step 4 mein strong finish do!

Key Takeaway: System design interview ka koi "perfect answer" nahi hota - interviewer tumhari thinking process, communication, collaboration, aur technical depth evaluate kar raha hai. Practice karo, think aloud karo, aur interviewer ko teammate ki tarah treat karo!
